title: Explained: The pros and cons of the rival Parliamentary moves to force a December general election
text:
What will MPs be voting on today?

The Government will table a motion calling for a December 12 election in return for reintroducing its Brexit bill with Parliament given until November 6 to pass it. However, under the Fixed Term Parliaments Act it requires a two thirds majority and is unlikely to pass.

How does the Lib Dem and SNP plan differ from Boris Johnson’s plan?

The two opposition parties’ Bill would amend the Fixed Term Parliaments Act to include the date of December 9 as the next general election. This would come into force if the EU decided to extend Article 50 to a date no earlier than January 31, as is expected.

Because it amends the Act, it only requires a simple majority to be passed...
description: What will MPs be voting on today?
